CatDescriptText: Cutline of related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 5, 1944, pg. 17 reads: "Shown above are Mrs. Bill (Bojangles) Robinson, left, and the inimitable Bojangles, who were quietly married in Columbus, Ohio, last Thursday. They were united by the Rev. H.N. Robinson, pastor of St. Paul church, Columbus, in home of Dr. Lloyd L. Jones.  Mayor J. H. Rhodes of the Ohio Capital, was the first to congratulate the famous 65-year-young dancer.  Bojangles' wife, the former Miss Elaine Plaines, of Brooklyn, N.Y., is 25...."Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 23, 1950, pg. 21, reads: "Mingled with Champions - Frank Sutton enjoyed the [illegible] of knowing more highly trained people than any other Pittsburgher of his time.  His intimate associated ranged from top leaders in public life, stage performers, boxers on [ill.] to the betting profession - all experts in their own fields.  On the left he is shown listening to one of Bill (Bojangles) Robinson's new stories in the dressing room of the Stanley Theatre..."
TitMainTitle: Frank Sutton with hands on shoe of Bill "Bojangles" Robinson in dressing room of the Stanley Theatre
